data: CARD STEMI Primary Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) - Ongoing Management (Module)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Please ensure CARD Critical Care Admission is ordered prior to proceeding
Medications
Ensure initial dose of antiplatelets have been administered
ASA EC
81 mg, PO, qdaily, drug form: tab-EC
Considerations when initiating and choosing P2Y12 Receptor Blocker:
For patients requiring long term anticoagulation, clopidogrel is preferred  Avoid ticagrelor in patients with severe bradycardia (heart rate less than 50 bpm)
Hold ticagrelor or clopidogrel until after angiogram has been performed - PREFERRED
None

Angiotensin Receptor Blocker (ARB) - indicated for ACE- inhibitor intolerance
Re-assess therapy if serum creatinine increases by more than 30% or if serum potassium rises above 5.2 mmol/L

Avoid nitroglycerin if any of the following are present:  - SBP below 90 mmHg or if more than 30 mmHg drop from baseline  - Suspected right ventricular infarction  - Recent use of phosphodiesterase inhibitors: within 24 hours for sildenafil [VIAGRA] and vardenafil [LEVITRA] and within 48 hours for tadalafil [CIALIS]
nitroglycerin 0.4 mg/spray spray
1 spray, sublingual, q5min, PRN pain-chest, drug form: spray
nitroglycerin titratable infusion (0.2 mg/mL) in D5W standard
Titrate, IV, 10 mcg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/min minimum rate, 200 mcg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: Titrate by 10 mcg/min, q5min PRN for symptoms of ischemia; maintain SPB above 90 mmHg
50 mg
